msgSnippet: I agree, I gave up on it.  More work then it was worth.  I keep an eye on it though, because I don t know if there is anything better. If it gets better, I may

I agree, I gave up on it.  More work then it was worth.  I keep an eye on it
though, because I don't know
if there is anything better. If it gets better, I may re-evaluate it.

-----Original Message-----
From: msonnet@... [mailto:msonnet@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 17, 2001 10:19 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] C++ Unit Tests



Effectively in their automatic generated tests, for example every exception
that is throw by the tested code is reported as an failure.

This seems to be ok for black box testing where you just want to "touch"
every single method and check that there is no access violation or overflow
but I don't see any other usefull features do you ?

Marc





"Joe Fisher" <jfisher@...> on 17.05.2001 17:12:17

Please respond to junit@yahoogroups.com

To:   <junit@yahoogroups.com>
cc:

Subject:  RE: [junit] C++ Unit Tests


I tried it for a while and it seamed flaky.

It would create a bunch of automatic tests, but I always ended up deleting
them and writing my own.  If I wasn't careful, it would crash and I would
lose all my tests.  I think it has potential, but it needs some work or
something (this is of course my opinion)

-----Original Message-----
From: msonnet@... [mailto:msonnet@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 17, 2001 9:41 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] C++ Unit Tests


Can anybody give some feedback on C++ Test from Parasoft ?


Thanks

Marc
